content.description:
Awesome face route with crimps, pockets, and pinches to pull on. 

  Goes straight up the face, starting left of the crack and then climbing straight through it.
content.location: Behind the Anthrax Spire is a short wall with two pine trees right in front of it. The left arching crack is "Death Wish". "Stomp 442" starts just left of a triangular ledge jutting out of the wall.

content.protection: Nuts and a hex or two will do ya!
content.location: Crack right of "Anthrax Dihedral". go stright up and stand on detached pillar, then climb up the face from there. You can clip the chains on "Anthrax" and get lowered from there.

content.description: Tricky slab. Gear is ok but spaced out. Do not fall! At the second horizontal plug in all the small cams you got and gun for the top.
content.protection: Cams and a few nuts to finish. Build an anchor at the top.
content.location: Around the corner from "Anthrax". Start with a mantle, then up to a horizontal with a cam placement. From there go up and left.

content.description:
There's no pro for the first ~15' so it's PG13 unless you scramble up on the right side to place a piece before starting.

 First half is a steepening slab with ample edges and ledges amongst the lichen. Pull up and right onto a ledge and a steep start to the crack. Great jams and pro in the crack, some friable rock outside.

 I imagine this has been climbed before. Anyone know the FA and real name?
content.location: Back of the Anthrax spire, uphill / around the corner (right) from Fistful of Metal.

climbs.name: Fistful of Metal
climbs.fa: Jack Klein and Steve Sangdahl ca. 1982

content.description: The better protected and better movement of the two face routes around the corner from "Anthrax".
content.protection: Cams, some nuts. Build an anchor at the top.
content.location: Right side of the face around the corner from "Anthrax". Start in an alcove with a perfect C4 #1 placement above your head. Head for the crack system up and left after that.

climbs.name: Death Wish
climbs.fa: Jack Kein and Steve Sangdahl ca. 1982

content.description: Good protection ends with a loose finish.
content.location: From the Ryan Hansen guide book: "Follow a trail to the right of Anthrax and scramble up the western side of the formation to a face with a diagonal crack system."

content.description: The dihedral and roof to the left of "Anita".
content.location: The dihedral and roof to the left of "Anita". Also, left of "Sound of White Noise".

content.description: The right hand bolted route. If you climb right on the bolts at the bottom using thin crimps, as Schmidt intended, the grade is 12c.  If you climb the nice arete to the right and stretch out to clip the bolts the whole thing will feel about .11a-ish.  This last way of climbing it is really enjoyable and I would give that 3 stars.

This is the short route on the left.  Some thin almost bouldery moves will take you up to a horizontal.  Here you need to have some 3/4 inch cams (yellow and orange Metolius).  Then up on more thin holds to a burly mantle move and the anchors.  The route could have gone higher and maybe someday will.

At the north end of the main spine is a tall grey wall with two bolted routes and some easy trad lines.  It can be quite noisy due to its proximity to the road, but can also be a shaded treat on hot days.
